posts.post_content:
whats the deal with these cards....the sellers appear be asking much higher  than market price (ie. if  cards go to auction).not even close....and yet if you try to sell them to non dealers the buyers ask for much less than market price.....except as to the major HOFs cobb/Johnson etc.. or super condition cards PSA 7+

I never seen such a price disparity in the PSA 4-6s......usually you will see 25% up or down versus ebay...but for t202s its like 50%..

also SMR not even close....

I think im done with buy mode..and now on to sell mode...

t202s may be my favorite set.  Or at least my favorite set that I am too scared to pursue.  I only have a few, but I like that you get two portraits along with an action scene all topped off with descriptions on the back.

There are some combos that are really hard and some that are fairly easy, so this could be leading to the price changes you have seen.
I also love t202s but not interested in pursuing a set due to all the duplication.  I just pick up the few I like here and there.

right all love..but no buying...

like when someone posts a card for sale and people comment how great the card is..but wont buy it themselves...

I love T202s for the reason mentioned (two portraits, action shot, write ups on back) and buy them whenever I see something I like.  This is probably the only I set in which I've bought several dupes.

If you're selling any, I'd gladly look whenever you're ready to post.
